_header: When Sol is in Aries and Phoebus shineth bright
Note:
All texts show variations; see Singer (1928)
XSinger, Dorothea Waley. Catalogue of Latin and Vernacular Alchemical Manuscripts. 3 vols. Brussels: Lamertin, 1928-31, 812; edition with source unattributed is Ashmole (1652)
XAshmole, Elias. Theatrum Chemicum Britannicum. London: J. Grimond, 1652, 380-88 (shorter version).
Bibliographic Ghosts: Lichfield, Lichfield Cathedral Library 18 [formerly MS 22], ff. 1-28v: prose version.
_description: George Ripley, The Mystery of Alchymysts — in quatrains

BosHistSoc.First Lines:
When sol in Ariete and phebus shynes bryghtThe Elementes reviuing
                    the new yere spryngyng…
BosHistSoc.Last Lines:
…Elles may ye lyghtie fayleWythout ye haue good
                    counsaylle
BosHistSoc.Note:
132 stanzas, usually cross-rhymed quatrains but occasional stanzas of
                    six lines, aabbcc, including the last.
